definition: (of two things) to come into contact/to meet/to hand over to/to take over from/to associate with/to have friendly relations with/to have sexual intercourse
to hand over/to deliver/to pay (money)/to turn over/to make friends/to intersect (lines)/variant of 跤[jiao1]
to receive/to answer (the phone)/to meet or welcome sb/to connect/to catch/to join/to extend/to take one's turn on duty/to take over for sb

sentences.english: And they continued stedfastly in the apostles' doctrine and fellowship, and in breaking of bread, and in prayers.
sentences.chinese: 都恒心遵守使徒的教训，彼此交接，擘饼，祈祷。

sentences.english: Shu Bote living in classicism and romanticism of the transition period.
sentences.chinese: 舒柏特生活在古典主义和浪漫主义的交接时期。

sentences.english: IX. Strictly stick to the handing-over system.
sentences.chinese: 第九条严格执行交接班制度。

sentences.english: If Financial Manager, the procedures will be done with the supervision of General Manager.
sentences.chinese: 财务经理交接工作时，要在总经理的监督下进行。

sentences.english: Task switching and hand-offs are similar kinds of waste.
sentences.chinese: 任务切换和交接是相似类型的消耗。

sentences.english: One to one, the junction is the leisurely Cher.
sentences.chinese: 一去一来，交接处，是雪儿的悠闲。

sentences.english: There will be a handing-over and taking-over ceremony in each closing ceremony of the Olympic Games.
sentences.chinese: 在这届奥运会闭幕式上首次举行了会旗的交接仪式，。

sentences.english: Jonas finally caught his father's eye and waved.
sentences.chinese: 乔纳斯终于与爸爸四目交接并挥著手。

sentences.english: The upper arm meets the shoulder blade at approximately a right angle.
sentences.chinese: 上臂和肩胛骨交接处形成一个直角。

sentences.english: The willingness of the ex-leader and the successor will also influence the results of the succession.
sentences.chinese: 前任和继任主体的交接意愿影响到继任的效果。

sentences.english: Ensuring the shift is reviewed and hand-over and briefings are carried out.
sentences.chinese: 确保每个班次的回顾交接班及例会的召开。

sentences.english: At the end of the day, days of the junction in the water, disturbed by the surging of the sea.
sentences.chinese: 在天的尽头，在水天交接处，海水不安地涌动着。

sentences.english: Hand over the work to the colleague of the next shift and make the relative records…
sentences.chinese: 同下一个班同事交接工作，并做好相应记录。

sentences.english: The Middle East is located in the junction of Europe, Asia and Africa.
sentences.chinese: 中东地处欧亚非三大洲交接处，战略地位十分重要。

sentences.english: The tremor was felt in many parts of neighbouring Thailand.
sentences.chinese: 在缅甸的内陆交接国泰国，很多地区都有震感。

sentences.english: In the Chung Yeung public life into summer and winter time of the handover landmark.
sentences.chinese: 重阳在民众生活中成为夏冬交接的时间界标。

definition: to get in touch with/to contact/to stay in contact (with)/liaison/(math.) connection
to assign (a task to different people)/to allocate
to coordinate/to harmonize/to fit together/to match (colors etc)/harmonious/concerted
to patrol/to make a tour/to inspect/to scan with one's eyes
to discuss a matter with sb/to get in touch with/to arrange
